P070232.project_name: Gabon: Strengthening Capacity for Managing National Parks and Biodiversity

keywords.cdata: Action Plans, air travel, animal, animal communities, approach to biodiversity, aquatic resources, awareness campaign, Basin, beaches, behavioral change, benefit sharing, BIODIVERSITY, Biodiversity component, biodiversity conservation, BIODIVERSITY PROJECT, biodiversity protection, biodiversity resources, biodiversity value, Bongo, border conservation, buffer zone, buffer zones, co-management, coastal ecosystems, coastal zone, coastal zone management, coastal zones, commercial hunters, community forests, complements, Conservation, Conservation efforts, conservation finance, conservation goals, conservation issues, conservation objectives, conservation partners, conservation practitioners, conservation projects, Conservation Society, conservation status, conservation strategies, cultural significance, debt, decision making, ecological surveys, economic analysis, economic development, economic impact, ecosystem, ecotourism development, Effective monitoring, Elephants, endemism, enforcement agencies, Environmental, environmental benefits, environmental damages, environmental goods, environmental impact, environmental impact assessment, Environmental Information, environmental issues, environmental management, Environmental policies, environmental protection, Environmental screening, Environmental Sustainability, equitable sharing, evolution, extractive activities, extractive industries, field activities, financial resources, Fisheries, fisheries authorities, fishing operations,

project_abstract.cdata: By working in national parks and surrounding buffer zones and production landscapes the Gabon Strengthening Capacity for Managing National Parks and Biodiversity Project adopts an integrated approach to biodiversity conservation. Implementation of concrete on-the-ground activities will strengthen organizational and operational capacities of national parks and wildlife authorities. There are four project components. Component 1 strengthens Institutions of National Agency of National Parks. Component 2 expands Gabon's protected area coverage Component 3 provides direct support to selected national parks. Component 4 finances wildlife management in production landscapes (the Loango, Mukalaba and Mayumba national parks and their buffer zones, and the buffer zones of Lopt and Bateke).

P070232.projectinfo: <![CDATA[<Project><LangCode>FR</LangCode><ProjectName>Gabon : Renforcer la capacité de gestion des parcs nationaux et de la biodiversité</ProjectName><ProjectAbstract>En intervenant au niveau des parcs nationaux ainsi que dans les zones tampons avoisinantes et les zones de production, le Projet visant à renforcer la capacité de gestion des parcs nationaux et la biodiversité du Gabon adopte une approche intégrée de la préservation de la biodiversité. La mise en œuvre d’activités concrètes sur le terrain permettra de renforcer les capacités organisationnelles et opérationnelles des autorités responsables des parcs nationaux et des espaces sauvages. Le projet s’articule autour de quatre composantes : La composante 1 renforce les institutions de l’Agence nationale des parcs nationaux. La composante 2 étend la couverture des aires protégées du Gabon. La composante 3 offre un appui direct aux parcs nationaux sélectionnés. La composante 4 finance la gestion des espèces sauvages dans les zones d’activité productive (parcs nationaux de Loango, de Mukalaba et de Mayumba et leurs zones tampons, ainsi que les zones tampons de Lopé et de Batéké).</ProjectAbstract></Project>]]>
